TopicTitle: "The Game that will make your children love physics"

Articles.Content:
Is the translated title of this Hebrew language review of Kerbal in one of Israel's leading newspapers, HaAretz. I can't beleive how big this game has gotten!

If anyone wants, I can try to translate the article later.....

http://www.haaretz.co.il/captain/games/1.2118068#commentsForm-2118068

Edited September 28, 2013 by dragoncannon
added link

Any chance of a link to the article?

Searching "HaAretz Kerbal Space Program" in Google came up with this http://www.haaretz.co.il/captain/games/1.2118068 but that might not be the one you're talking about. It does however have the same title, provided "Still" is replaced with "With" in Google Translate

-----

Anyway, leading newpaper
oops... but good searching, you found the right article!

Nice find! Google translate has issues with language nuances.

So "send little people to space' became send "pupils to chambers" but it's mostly readable.

http://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=en&u=http%3A//www.haaretz.co.il/captain/games/1.2118068

And to think I spent 10 minutes copying (and reverse copying...opposite alignment confuses me ) and pasting manually into Google Translate...I should really remember that webpage translator.

Anyway, easier-to-read-with-no-ads pastebin file:

http://pastebin.com/wu4Q4Rn1

Anyway, looks like KSP is slowly teaching the world that games CAN be good for your education*

*Provided your education involves Physics, Mathematics or Engineering.

Felipe Flnhh?

Besides that, it's great to see KSP get as much exposure as possible.
